subarticle.title: Why am I asked to sign in again to my account?
subarticle.description: Whenever a time interval (about 20 minutes) has passed, you'll be asked again to sign in to your HTC Watch account before you can continue to rent or purchase videos or access some settings. This is a safety precaution to check your identity and to ensure that you acknowledge that it is your account.

subarticle.title: How long is the rental period of a video?
subarticle.description: Depending on the studio's terms and the country where you downloaded the video, the rental period is either 24 or 48 hours, starting from the first viewing.

subarticle.title: Why won't HTC Watch allow me to remove a device and add a new one?
subarticle.description: You can only remove an HTC device once every 120 days.

article.description: When you enable Airplane (Flight) mode, all wireless radios on [generic phone name] are turned off, including the call function, data services, Bluetooth, and Wi‑Fi.

article.keywords: Airplane mode, radio, airplane

subarticle.title: Restoring a SIM card that has been locked out
subarticle.description: If you enter the wrong PIN more times than the maximum number of attempts allowed, your SIM card will become “PUK-locked.”

article.title: Protecting [generic phone name] with a screen lock
article.description: Protect your personal information and prevent others from using [generic phone name] without your permission by setting a screen lock pattern, face unlock, PIN, or password.

subarticle.title: Forgot your screen lock pattern?
subarticle.description: If you’ve forgotten your screen lock pattern, you have up to five attempts to try and unlock [generic phone name].
